description:
Citricoccus alkalitolerans is a species of bacterium that belongs to the genus Citricoccus, within the phylum Actinobacteria. It is a Gram-positive, non-spore-forming, and non-motile coccus-shaped bacterium.

The distinctive features of Citricoccus alkalitolerans are its ability to tolerate alkaline conditions, with an optimal growth pH range between 7.0 and 9.0. It is capable of utilizing a variety of carbohydrates as carbon sources, including glucose, fructose, and sucrose.

Citricoccus alkalitolerans was first isolated from a soil sample collected from an alkaline environment. It is known to be a halotolerant organism, capable of growing in the presence of moderate concentrations of sodium chloride.

This species has been studied for its potential applications in bioremediation and biotechnology due to its ability to tolerate alkaline conditions and its metabolic versatility. Further research is ongoing to explore its ecological role and potential industrial uses.
